author: Lian Buan
title: De Lima at Camp Crame
text:
Philippines De Lima at Camp Crame The senator is expected to be detained at the custodial center where 2 former senators she helped put to jail are also detained Published 8:51  08   SUPPORT. Supporters of Senator Leila de Lima outside the Senate building shortly after she surrendered to the PNP. Photo by Alecs Ongcal/Rappler 
  Senator Leila de Lima arrived at Camp Crame, headquarters of the Philippine National Police (PNP), Friday morning around 8:41 am, for booking procedures with the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group. 
De Lima earlier surrendered to the PNP at the Senate, where she spent the night. 
De Lima was accompanied by her party mate, Liberal Party president Senator Francis Pangilinan, lawyers and staff. 
The detention of the senator at Camp Crame is "temporary," said Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella in an interview with CNN Philippines, pending the decision of Muntinlupa Judge Juanita Guerrero, who's handling the drug charges against her. (READ: Who is judge who ordered De Lima's arrest? ) 
As of posting, she's inside the CIDG office. 
Currently detained at the PNP Custodial Center are senators Bong Revilla and Jinggoy Estrada, who face plunder charges on the basis of, among others, an investigation by the justice department, which was then headed by De Lima under the previous Aquino administration. 
This is a developing story.
